lines: Oh, hello! I'm Emma. Lovely to meet you.
Valentin always throws such wonderful parties.
I can't wait to try his erdbeerstrudel - everyone raves about it!
introduction.notebookNote: Emma seems excited about the party and Valentin's famous strudel.

lines: This is terrible! Who would do such a thing?
I was near the bookshelf when Valentin left for the kitchen.
I didn't see anyone go near the strudel, I swear!
followUpLines: I really didn't see anything suspicious.
Maybe someone from the other side of the room?
This is so awkward... I just wanted to enjoy the party.

lines: You found something? What is it?
Oh... well, I suppose everyone was moving around a lot.
Have you checked Valentin's desk? He keeps all sorts of papers there.
followUpLines: Did you look at the desk yet?
I'm sure it wasn't me... right?
This whole situation is making me nervous.
postIncident.notebookNote: Emma suggested checking Valentin's desk. Why would she know about papers there?

lines: You're really getting close to solving this, aren't you?
I... I have to admit something.
I wasn't entirely honest before. I did see someone near the dessert table, but I don't want to accuse anyone without proof.
followUpLines: It's hard to know who to trust right now.
Everyone seems suspicious when you look closely enough.
I hope this gets resolved soon. The tension is unbearable.
postIncident.notebookNote: Emma admits she saw someone near the dessert table but won't say who. Protecting someone?

lines: I suppose there's no point hiding it anymore.
The person I saw... was Luca. But please, don't tell him I told you!
followUpLines: What if I'm wrong? What if it wasn't Luca?
Please be discreet with this information.
postIncident.notebookNote: Emma finally admits she saw Luca near the dessert table. Is she telling the truth or deflecting?
